Silver Lake Partners, Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund PIF, and Affinity Partners will…

Silver Lake Partners, Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund PIF, and Affinity Partners will…

items.title: Video game maker Electronic Arts to be taken private in record $55bn mega-deal
items.standfirst: Deal with The Sims and Madden NFL maker is biggest leveraged buyout attempt, another key move for Silver LakeElectronic Arts, maker of video games such as Madden NFL, Battlefield, and The Sims, is being acquired for $55bn, the biggest leveraged buyout attempt in history.Under the terms of the deal announced on Monday, the private equity firm Silver Lake Partners, Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund PIF and Affinity Partners will pay EA’s stockholders $210 per share. Affinity Partners is a private equity firm run by Donald Trump’s son-in-law, Jared Kushner. Continue reading...
items.content: Deal with The Sims and Madden NFL maker is biggest leveraged buyout attempt, another key move for Silver LakeElectronic Arts, maker of video games such as Madden NFL, Battlefield, and The Sims, is being acquired for $55bn, the biggest leveraged buyout attempt in history.Under the terms of the deal announced on Monday, the private equity firm Silver Lake Partners, Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund PIF and Affinity Partners will pay EA’s stockholders $210 per share. Affinity Partners is a private equity firm run by Donald Trump’s son-in-law, Jared Kushner. Continue reading...

items.content: Saudi-backed transaction orchestrated by Jared Kushner and Silver Lake is biggest-ever leveraged buyout

clusters.title: China: World's highest bridge opens to traffic
clusters.neutral_headline: World's Highest Bridge Opens in China

items.title: China: World's highest bridge opens to traffic
items.standfirst: 🇨🇳 World's highest bridge opens to traffic 🌉 The world's highest bridge opened to traffic in China, capping an engineering feat three years in the making and snatching the record from another bridge in the same province. ⛰️ The Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge towers 625 metres (2,051 feet) above a river and vast gorge in the country's rugged southern province of Guizhou, also home to the 565-metre Beipanjiang Bridge that is now the world's second highest.
items.content: 🇨🇳 World's highest bridge opens to traffic 🌉 The world's highest bridge opened to traffic in China, capping an engineering feat three years in the making and snatching the record from another bridge in the same province. ⛰️ The Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge towers 625 metres (2,051 feet) above a river and vast gorge in the country's rugged southern province of Guizhou, also home to the 565-metre Beipanjiang Bridge that is now the world's second highest.

items.title: China opens the world's highest bridge — 2,050 feet above a gorge
items.standfirst: The world’s highest bridge opened in China on Sunday, taking the crown from another bridge in the same province.
items.content: The world’s highest bridge opened in China on Sunday, taking the crown from another bridge in the same province.

items.title: Watch: World's highest bridge opens in China
items.standfirst: The Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge towers 625m (2,083ft) above a gorge in the country's Guizhou province.
items.content: The Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge towers 625m (2,083ft) above a gorge in the country's Guizhou province.

ai_summary: The Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge opened to traffic.
The bridge is in China's Guizhou province.
It towers 625 meters above a gorge.
The bridge is the world's highest.
The project took three years to complete.

clusters.title: Title: India: Dozens dead, over 50 injured at actor-politician Vijay's rally
clusters.neutral_headline: Stampede at Vijay Rally in India Kills Dozens

items.title: Title: India: Dozens dead, over 50 injured at actor-politician Vijay's rally
items.standfirst: 🇮🇳 At least 39 people were killed in a stampede during a rally for Tamil actor-turned-politician Vijay in Karur, southern India. The state has ordered an inquiry and police have filed a criminal case against leaders of Vijay’s party.
items.content: 🇮🇳 At least 39 people were killed in a stampede during a rally for Tamil actor-turned-politician Vijay in Karur, southern India. The state has ordered an inquiry and police have filed a criminal case against leaders of Vijay’s party.

items.title: India: Who is Vijay, whose last political rally caused a massive stampede?
items.standfirst: 🇮🇳❓Who is Vijay? ⚡ A stampede at a rally for a popular Indian actor and politician in the southern state of Tamil Nadu killed at least 36 people and injured 40 others. 👨🏽 The rally, which officials say was attended by tens of thousands of people, was being addressed by Vijay, one of Tamil Nadu’s most successful actors-turned-politician in the district of Karur. Who exactly is he?
items.content: 🇮🇳❓Who is Vijay? ⚡ A stampede at a rally for a popular Indian actor and politician in the southern state of Tamil Nadu killed at least 36 people and injured 40 others. 👨🏽 The rally, which officials say was attended by tens of thousands of people, was being addressed by Vijay, one of Tamil Nadu’s most successful actors-turned-politician in the district of Karur. Who exactly is he?

items.title: The Indian superstar whose political rally turned fatal for dozens
items.standfirst: At least 40 people died over the weekend in a crowd crush at a political rally organised by Vijay's party.
items.content: At least 40 people died over the weekend in a crowd crush at a political rally organised by Vijay's party.

items.title: At least 40 dead and 124 injured in crush at Vijay rally in India
items.standfirst: Victims include nine children at election campaign gathering in Tamil Nadu led by popular actor and politicianPolice in India have opened a criminal case against the leaders of a party headed by the actor turned politician Vijay, after a crowd crush at one of his rallies killed 40 people and injured at least 124 others.Local officials reported that at least nine children had died at the rally, which took place on Saturday night in the Karur district of Tamil Nadu state in southern India. Vijay, one of the most popular and successful actors in Tamil cinema, who entered politics last year, was addressing the crowd for his Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) party before state elections early next year. Continue reading...
items.content: Victims include nine children at election campaign gathering in Tamil Nadu led by popular actor and politicianPolice in India have opened a criminal case against the leaders of a party headed by the actor turned politician Vijay, after a crowd crush at one of his rallies killed 40 people and injured at least 124 others.Local officials reported that at least nine children had died at the rally, which took place on Saturday night in the Karur district of Tamil Nadu state in southern India. Vijay, one of the most popular and successful actors in Tamil cinema, who entered politics last year, was addressing the crowd for his Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) party before state elections early next year. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A stampede at a rally killed at least 39 people.
The rally was for actor-turned-politician Vijay.
Police have filed a criminal case against party leaders.
The rally was held in Karur, southern India.
At least nine children died in the stampede.

clusters.title: Madagascar’s president dissolves government amid youth-led protests
clusters.neutral_headline: Madagascar President Dissolves Government

items.title: Madagascar’s president dissolves government amid youth-led protests
items.standfirst: Demonstrations over water and power cuts inspired by ‘gen-Z’ protests elsewhere have left at least 22 dead, says UNMadagascar’s president, Andry Rajoelina, has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts in which the UN says at least 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured.Inspired by the “gen Z” protests in Kenya and Nepal, the three days of demonstrations are the largest the Indian Ocean island has seen in years, and the most serious challenge Rajoelina has faced since his re-election in 2023. Continue reading...
items.content: Demonstrations over water and power cuts inspired by ‘gen-Z’ protests elsewhere have left at least 22 dead, says UNMadagascar’s president, Andry Rajoelina, has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts in which the UN says at least 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured.Inspired by the “gen Z” protests in Kenya and Nepal, the three days of demonstrations are the largest the Indian Ocean island has seen in years, and the most serious challenge Rajoelina has faced since his re-election in 2023. Continue reading...

items.title: ‘Violent response’ to youth-led protests in Madagascar leave at least 22 dead, U.N. says
items.standfirst: The United Nations’ human rights office says that violence surrounding youth-led anti-government protests in the Indian Ocean island of Madagascar over the past several days has killed at least 22 people.
items.content: The United Nations’ human rights office says that violence surrounding youth-led anti-government protests in the Indian Ocean island of Madagascar over the past several days has killed at least 22 people.

ai_summary: Madagascar's president dissolved the government.
The move follows youth-led protests.
The protests were over water and power cuts.

items.title: Covid school closures in UK damaged ‘very fabric of childhood’
items.standfirst: Inquiry hears of children exposed to pornography and suffering ‘grievous’ harm without protection of schoolsThe Covid pandemic disrupted the “very fabric of childhood”, the UK inquiry has heard, on the first day of a four-week session devoted to its impact on children and young people.Clair Dobbin KC, counsel to the inquiry, said in her opening submission on Monday that some of the evidence drawn from the 18,000 stories and 400 targeted interviews would be “hard to listen to”. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

clusters.title: Afghanistan faces communications blackout after Taliban shut down internet
clusters.neutral_headline: Afghanistan faces communications blackout after Taliban shut down internet

items.title: Afghanistan faces communications blackout after Taliban shut down internet

items.content: Taliban authorities on Monday imposed a nationwide shutdown of communications, weeks after they began shutting down high-speed internet in several provinces as part of a campaign to prevent "vice".

items.title: Afghanistan hit by communications blackout after Taliban shuts internet
items.standfirst: Telecoms disrupted nationwide after authorities cut fibre-optic connections in several provinces to prevent ‘vice’A huge communications blackout has hit Afghanistan after Taliban authorities began severing fibre-optic connections in several provinces to prevent “vice”.“A nationwide telecoms blackout is now in effect,” said Netblocks, a watchdog organisation that monitors cybersecurity and internet governance. Continue reading...
items.content: Telecoms disrupted nationwide after authorities cut fibre-optic connections in several provinces to prevent ‘vice’A huge communications blackout has hit Afghanistan after Taliban authorities began severing fibre-optic connections in several provinces to prevent “vice”.“A nationwide telecoms blackout is now in effect,” said Netblocks, a watchdog organisation that monitors cybersecurity and internet governance. Continue reading...

This action followed the shutdown of high-speed internet in several provinces.
The Taliban's actions are part of a campaign to prevent "vice".
Telecoms were disrupted nationwide after authorities cut fibre-optic connections.
Netblocks, a cybersecurity watchdog, confirmed the nationwide telecoms blackout.

clusters.title: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response
clusters.neutral_headline: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response

items.title: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response
items.standfirst: A third of Etosha national park has been burned despite efforts of volunteers, who say troops were sent in too lateWildfires that raged through one of Africa’s largest national parks have been brought under control, Namibia’s government has said, amid criticisms over the response mechanism and limited resources.The fire broke out in Etosha national park, in the arid desert nation’s north, on 22 September. The government said it suspected charcoal production next to the park, which is home to 114 mammal species including the critically endangered black rhino, was to blame. Continue reading...
items.content: A third of Etosha national park has been burned despite efforts of volunteers, who say troops were sent in too lateWildfires that raged through one of Africa’s largest national parks have been brought under control, Namibia’s government has said, amid criticisms over the response mechanism and limited resources.The fire broke out in Etosha national park, in the arid desert nation’s north, on 22 September. The government said it suspected charcoal production next to the park, which is home to 114 mammal species including the critically endangered black rhino, was to blame. Continue reading...

items.title: Army sent to battle fire in Namibia tourist hotspot
items.standfirst: Etosha National Park is home to endangered black rhinos and more than 100 diverse mammal species.
items.content: Etosha National Park is home to endangered black rhinos and more than 100 diverse mammal species.

items.title: Namibia deploys army to fight wildfire burning third of Etosha game reserve
items.standfirst: Vast tract of park that is home to 114 mammal species, including critically endangered black rhino, affectedNamibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of the vast Etosha national park, one of Africa’s largest game reserves, officials said.The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros, and is a major tourist attraction. Continue reading...
items.content: Vast tract of park that is home to 114 mammal species, including critically endangered black rhino, affectedNamibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of the vast Etosha national park, one of Africa’s largest game reserves, officials said.The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros, and is a major tourist attraction. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A wildfire in Etosha National Park has been brought under control.
The government faced criticism over the response mechanism and limited resources.
The fire broke out on September 22 in the arid desert nation's north.
The government suspects charcoal production near the park was to blame.
The park is home to 114 mammal species, including the black rhino.
